page.title: 16Transport
page.content: It is vital for everyone in this area to have their own motor transport - many people live in isolated valleys which have never had public transport apart from school buses. Public bus services have almost ceased - one regular bus runs through Whitton on one day per week only and this runs only to Knighton (4miles). Visits to towns further afield are by specially arranged hire coaches only or cars have to be used to gain access to route terminals in towns. The Central Wales Railway line runs through Knighton (Swansea to Shrewsbury) with conncections to all major towns which is very good in this day and age but, again, the problem is getting to the station without your own transport, and the fact that trains are relatively few. An active supporters club seeks to keep the railway open.
